com.okta.scim.util.model
Class SCIMUser

java.lang.Object
  com.okta.scim.util.model.SCIMResource
      com.okta.scim.util.model.SCIMUser

public class SCIMUser
extends SCIMResource

A wrapper over the UnboundID representation of a SCIM user.

SCIMUser has two properties:

  1. UserResource, an UnboundID representation of a SCIM User, is used to get all the Standard Properties (Core Schema) of the User. The standard properties of SCIMUser which would be converted to and from Okta are the userName, password, id (converted into the Okta App User's externalId), name (name.familyName and name.givenName), emails (primary and secondary), phone numbers (primary), and status.

    This is how you can set the standard properties:

    1. SCIMUser user = new SCIMUser(); //Create an empty user
    2. UserResource stdUser = user.getStandardUser(); //Get the empty standard user out of the SCIM user
    3. stdUser.setUserName("someValue"); //Start setting the values for the standard properties
    4. stdUser.setId("someOtherValue");
    5. Collection<Entry<String>> emails = new ArrayList>(); //emails and phone numbers are arrays.

      You need to create a collection like this

          Entry email1 = new Entry("abc@eample.com", "work", true);
    ...
    emails.add(email1);
    6. stdUser.setEmails(emails); //Set the array emails to the user
    7. Name name = new Name("Mr. John Smith", "Smith", null, "John", null, null); //Name is a complex property.
      Create like this: stdUser.setName(name); //Set the name to the standard user
    8. user.setStandardUser(stdUser); //Set the standard user to the SCIMUser

    Similarly, get these standard properties as follows:

    1. String userName = user.getStandardUser().getUserName(); //Get a non-nested simple property like userName, Id, ExternalId, Status
    2. String firstName = user.getStandardUser().getName().getGivenName(); //Get a nested simple property like firstName, lastName
    3. Entry firstEntry = user.getStandardUser().getEmails().get(0); //Get an array element
    4. String firstEmail = firstEntry.getValue(); //Get the value of that array element

  2. If you need to set properties in addition to the standard properties, you can set them as custom properties in a namespace different from that of the standard properties. Note that currently only one custom namespace is supported. The custom namespace is based on the appName you created on Okta. For example, if your appName is onprem_app, the custom namespace would be urn:okta:onprem_app:1.0:user. In general, the custom namespace would of the form urn:okta:{appName}:1.0:user. You need to know your appName if you want to use the custom namespaces. You can login to Okta and go to your App to find this information.

    The datatypes supported are String, Boolean, Integer, and Double.

    There are two ways to get and set CustomProperties. In the examples below, assume that the custom namespace is urn:okta:onprem_app:1.0:user.

    1. Access the customPropertiesMap of SCIMUser which is a CustomSchemaName -> JsonNode map for all the custom properties.

      Example to Set a custom property

       JsonNode node = new JsonNode(); //Create a Jackson Json Node
 node.put("customField1", "abc"); //Set string value
 node.put("customField2", 123);   //Set an int value
 Map customMap = new HashMap(); //Create a new map to be set to the SCIMUser
 customMap.put("urn:okta:onprem_app:1.0:user", node); //Put an entry in the map with the URN
 user.setCustomPropertiesMap(customMap); //Set the custom properties map to the SCIM user

      Example to Get a custom property

       String customField1 = user.getCustomPropertiesMap().get("urn:okta:onprem_app:1.0:user").get("customField1").asText();
 You need to traverse the Json Node if the custom field is nested.

    2. Use getters and setters – SCIMUser.getCustomStringProperty, getCustomIntProperty, setCustomStringProperty, setCustomIntProperty, etc.

      Example to Set a custom property

       user.setCustomStringValue("urn:okta:onprem_app:1.0:user", "customField1", "abc"); //Set a root level custom property
 user.setCustomStringValue("urn:okta:onprem_app:1.0:user", "customField1", "abc", "root", "subRoot"); //Set a nested custom property
 //where the "subRoot" is the parent of "customField1" and "root" is the parent of "subRoot".
      Similar methods including setCustomIntValue, setCustomDoubleValue, setCustomBooleanValue exist for the other data types.

      Example to Get a custom property

       user.getCustomStringValue("urn:okta:onprem_app:1.0:user", "customField1"); //Get a root level custom property
 user.getCustomStringValue("urn:okta:onprem_app:1.0:user", "customField1", "root", "subRoot"); //Get a nested custom property

To understand more about the UnboundID SDK and how to work with the SCIMUser.standardUser, the UnboundID UserResource and SCIMGroup.standardGroup, the UnboundID GroupResource, you can go to https://code.google.com/p/scimsdk/ and download the SDK which contains the Javadoc.
